IIT Roorkee inks MoU with IIT BHU.description: Dehradun: IIT Roorkee and IIT BHU signed an MoU for mentoring and providing academic support to the new department of Architecture and Planning at the latter’s campus in Varanasi. The institutes will undertake activities which include exchange of scientific & technical information, collaborative research activities, faculty & staff visits, joint supervision of postgraduate (including PhD) students, joint organisation of seminars & conferences and sharing the databank of information through their libraries. The MoU signing took place at IIT Roorkee between Professor Ajit K Chaturvedi, IIT Roorkee director and professor, and Pramod Kumar Jain, IIT BHU director. Notably, the department of Architecture and Planning at IIT Roorkee has been playing a pivotal role in providing the best practices in the study and research of architecture and planning in the country for over six decades. \u2018Apologetic for deed\u2019, Almora.description: DEHRADUN: A middle-aged man, who along with four others accused of raping a Dalit girl in Almora, has committed suicide by consuming acid on Thursday. He was apologetic for his deed, said the man’s family. Chandan Ram, 48, was one of the five accused of raping the 13-year-old girl for over a year. The minor girl was taken to a hospital after she complained stomach ache and doctors found that she was pregnant. The girl delivered a stillborn earlier this week after which the matter came to light. The 48-year-old was reportedly the first to rape the girl. He then threatened her to remain quiet and later passed on the message in the village. Soon, four other villagers also took turns to rape her. Chandan’s brother, who reached Almora district hospital on Friday to take the body, told cops that he was apologetic for his deed. He consumed acid in the washroom. SDM Almora (Sadar), Seema Vishwakarma, told TOI that the girl was raped by five men of her own village who belonged to the same community, for over a year. “The girl is now suffering from severe depression and told us that she was threatened of dire consequences by the rapists for not sharing their crime with anyone else. They didn’t gangrape her, but lured her on different occasions and forced themselves on her,” she said, adding that it was all started by the middle-aged man last year. The man used to lure the girl to his home for sweets and then raped her. He then passed on the message to his friends who too opted for the same deed. SSP Almora Prahlad Narayan Meena told TOI that the accused, who died after drinking acid, was one of the five persons named in the FIR by the girl’s father. “We have taken over the case from revenue police. The deceased’s body was handed over to his family after post-mortem. We will soon launch a manhunt to arrest the rest of the accused,” he added. According to police, the accused includes a father-son duo, two brothers and Chandan. The police have so far refused to name the rest of the accused. AIIMS Rishikesh medicos go on strike ove.description: DEHRADUN: The brutal assault on a Kolkata-based doctor on Monday, which triggered massive protests among medicos in the country, hit health services at AIIMS Rishikesh as all the resident doctors participated in the all-India strike of doctors on Friday. Over 450 resident doctors of AIIMS Rishikesh remained off duty on Friday from 8 am to 8 pm and boycotted the OPD (Out Patient Department) services. However, the emergency services worked as usual. The doctors also took out a protest march in the campus shouting slogans and holding placards with messages like “Save The Saviours”, “Stop Violence Against Doctors” among others. The protestors also put bandages on their heads as a mark of protest against the attack on the junior doctor at Nil Ratan Sarkar (NRS) Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata. Dr Pahel M Soibam, president of the resident doctors' association of AIIMS Rishikesh, told TOI that the doctors remained on strike for 12 hours and OPD services will continue as usual from Saturday. “We work in one of the worst conditions. We are not given proper wages, and on top of all this, we are beaten as well. Is it wrong to ask for workplace security?" he asked. Commenting on the protest, AIIMS Rishikesh PRO Harish Thapliyal said that no major crisis happened in the hospital during the strike. However, some patients in the OPD had to return without being attended. Meanwhile, Meerut doctors on Friday wore helmets and black badges while tending to patients to protest against the mob attack on the doctor in Kolkata Medical College. City doctors also condemned the incident in Kolkata and demanded proper security for doctors so that they can work properly. Notably, the protests come in the backdrop of mob thrashing of Paribaha Mukherjee, a doctor at Kolkata's NRS Medical College. Reportedly, he was attacked on Monday by a mob of around 200 people after a 75-year-old patient died of cardiac arrest. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

The chief guest was Baby Rani Maurya. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Almora rape accused sent to 14-day judic.description: DEHRADUN: Three men accused of raping a 13-year-old Dalit girl were produced in court and were later sent to a 14-day judicial custody on Saturday. Talking to TOI, circle officer Almora, Kamal Ram Arya said that the accused identified as Mahendra Kumar, Pankaj Arya and Rajan Ram were arrested from their residences on Friday. “Police teams will be sent to arrest one more accused who works outstation,” Arya said. A thirteen-year-old Dalit girl from Almora was raped by five men including two brothers, a middle aged man and a teenager, for over a year. The matter came to light when the minor victim delivered a still born baby in government district women hospital on Monday. Notably, one of the accused in the case, Chandan Ram, 48, committed suicide by consuming poison on Thursday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Now, plant a sapling in memory of a love.description: Haridwar: Now, pilgrims visiting Uttarakhand can plant a sapling in memory of their loved one and also see the tree grow using a mobile app. The state forest department has also earmarked for the project specified forest areas which are being developed as ‘Smriti Van’ (Forest of memories). The initiative was kickstarted at Haridwar on Sunday by Garhwal commissioner Basava Purushottam. Foundation stones were also laid for the project at Digoli van panchayat in Chamoli, Batola on the Rishikesh-Badrinath national highway, Rishikesh-Haridwar bypass in Dehradun, horticulture farm in Uttarkashi and Ratura in Rudraprayag. Speaking to TOI, Purushottam said that local villagers are being taken into the loop to ensure that the saplings are cared for properly.“The self-help groups of the respective Ganga grams (villages located along river Ganga) and van panchayats would ensure that the planted saplings are guarded well and their maintenance, watering and online updating of latest pictures in the app is done in a timely manner.” he added. Terming the initiative as “a unique way in which people can pay homage to their ancestors and deceased loved ones”, tourism minister Satpal Maharaj said, “Uttarakhand is Dev Boomi and people come here for spiritual salvation. Smriti Van will be one more opportunity and a unique way to pay tribute to departed souls.” He added that he has also shared a plan with the state government to make a separate 'Smriti Van' at Kedarnath in the memory of the 2013 disaster victims. In Haridwar, the Ganga Vatika in Kankhal and Khadkadi area have been chosen for creating the ‘Forest of memories’. Speaking to TOI, district magistrate of Haridwar Deepak Rawat said that “cremation committees are being asked to promote the environment-friendly cause by motivating those who visit Haridwar for cremation and related activities.” Incidentally, each sapling would be geo-tagged and its geo-location would be shared with the person planting the sapling. “Each sapling will have a ‘special identity’ so that its owner doesn’t get confused. A unique bar code will be issued at the time of planting that would also be tagged with the plant and every week, the picture of the plant would be uploaded in the app for the users to see,” said Purushotam. While a fee of Rs 2,000 is being charged for every sapling in Haridwar, the price of the saplings and their maintenance charges would vary from district to district. (with inputs by Ishita Mishra) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Night stays close in Corbett ahead of mo.description: Nainital: Zones for tourists’ night stay in Corbett Tiger Reserve have been closed from Friday. Night stay for tourists opens in Dhikala, Bijrani, Dhela and Jhirna zones of the CTR on November 15 and closes on June 15 every year. However, day visits will be allowed till June 30. Officials told TOI that on an average, 1000 tourists visited the CTR every day since it was opened for safari on November 15. The tiger reserve receives an average footfall of 2.5 between November 15 and June 15. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Rain, thunderstorms in U\u2019khand from.description: Dehradun: After a prolonged dry spell and rising temperatures across Uttarakhand, the Met office has predicted rainfall accompanied by thunderstorm at several places of the hill state from June 16. The announcement has come as a relief for Doon residents, who have been reeling under hot conditions for the last fortnight. The maximum temperature has so far been above normal in both hills and plains. Meanwhile, the regional meteorological centre has forecast light to moderate showers, accompanied by thunder at several places in Uttarakhand from June 16 to 18. According to Bikram Singh, director at regional meteorological centre, “The weather will get considerably intense on June 17, with many places in the state likely to witness rainfall and thunderstorms. The activity will bring down the temperatures, which are currently settling above normal.” Singh added after the wet spell, temperatures will hover around normal and are not likely to rise above it, like they have been from the beginning of June. “There is a reversal of winds and the temperatures would now remain around normal till the onset of monsoon in the state,” said Bikram Singh. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Animal husbandry dept seeks status repor.description: Dehradun: Taking note of a TOI report which highlighted the death of a dozen ponies, which are used to ferry pilgrims to Kedarnath shrine, the secretary of animal husbandry department on Thursday sought a status report from the Rudraprayag district administration and asked it to work out a plan to improve the facilities at the earliest. Speaking to TOI, secretary of animal husbandry, R Meenakshi Sundaram said DM Mangesh Ghildiyal and Garhwal animal husbandry department have been asked to file a status report on the causes of death. “It's appalling if ponies are dying due to lack of facilities. The two officials would file a report on this aspect.” This year, over 7,000 ponies were allowed in Kedarnath to ferry the pilgrims. According to an estimate, over 80 ponies died last year. Responding to the issue, DM Mangesh Ghildiyal said, “This year, we have earmarked places for ponies on the route and also deployed veterinary doctors to provide medical help to the ailing ponies.” Responding to allegations of owners abandoning their ailing ponies, Sundaram said, “The pony owners will face action for abandoning them. I have also asked the officials to find out if the owners are administering any injections or drugs to ponies.” On Thursday, TOI had reported that since the commencement of Char Dham Yatra, over a dozen ponies, used to carry pilgrims, have lost their lives due to inadequate arrangements for animals along the yatra route. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Sikh beaten in Delhi.description: NEW DELHI: There was high drama in north Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar on Sunday evening when a group of policemen clashed with a Gramin Sewa driver and his son, a minor. The incident was captured by passersby on mobile phone and the footage went viral. In the video, a few policemen were seen hitting the driver with sticks and then kicking him. The man was later detained. However, Delhi Police, in a statement, claimed that the incident took place after the driver hit a police van and started arguing with cops. Things took a turn for the worse as the driver then allegedly pulled out a sword and assaulted an on-duty officer. While trying to escape from the spot, the accused hit another cop with his vehicle, police said. Later, the policemen chased the vehicle and forced the driver to stop. The juvenile son of the driver also joined the argument, they said. In another video of the incident, the driver was seen arguing with a cop while holding a sword. An inquiry has been initiated into the incident. Meanwhile, five people, including two women, were arrested for assaulting cops who tried to intervene in a fight near Tibia college in central Delhi. The incident happened on Friday evening. CCTV footage was being checked to ascertain the exact sequence of events, police said. In Video:On cam: Sikh driver, his son beaten, dragged and kicked on road by Delhi PoliceDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Uttarakhand should get funds for contrib.description: DEHRADUN: Speaking at the fifth governing council meeting of the Niti Aayog in New Delhi on Saturday, chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat said that the Union government should allocate a separate fund for Uttarakhand as the Himalayan state is responsible for maintaining over two-thirds of the forest cover in the country. The CM said that the fund should be provided to encourage more and more people to contribute to increasing green cover in the country. He also urged the Centre to include home-grown agricultural products like ragi (mandua) and barnyard millet (jhingoria) in mid-day meals to promote their cultivation. Rawat also said that the state has received a total of Rs 14,545 crore as investment since the Investors’ Summit in 2018. “Over 600 MoUs have been signed as part of this. The state has also initiated various steps to check migration from the hills,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

1st batch of Kailash pilgrims reach Bund.description: Pithoragarh: The first batch of this year’s Kailash Mansarovar pilgrims reached Bundi on Friday morning from Dharchula, where they had reached on Thursday night. The batch, consisting of 58 pilgrims, was flagged off from Dharchula by the chairman of Kumaon Mandal Vikas Nigam (KMVN), Kedar Joshi. The agency is organizing the Kailash pilgrimage on the Indian side. This year, there is a motorable road till Nagang, which is why pilgrims will go there in vehicles. Till last year, pilgrims had to trek on the Sirkha and Gala route to reach Nagang. The group consists of 58 members, including nine women. The KMVN has provided 30 porters and 35 ponies for the pilgrims to carry their luggage. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

10 choppers to make 50 sorties to ferry.description: Dehradun: Ten hired choppers would undertake over 50 sorties to fly over 150 selected guests coming from across the globe to the picturesque Auli where the grand weddings of the sons of Gupta brothers are being held at an altitude of over 12,000 feet in Chamoli district. The Indian-born South African business tycoons, who have been at the centre of a scandal due to their proximity with former South African president Jacob Zuma, are in Auli. The family has been overseeing the preparations of the grand wedding and welcoming the high-profile guests. On Monday, when the ceremonies of the weddings would begin in Auli, the Uttarakhand high court would also hear a PIL alleging environmental damages due to the lavish event. At the hotel, where royal tents have been erected in the open space, all the arrangements have been made for the guests, who would be flown from Sahastradhara helipad to Auli. “According to a tentative estimate, over Rs 2 crore would be spent on the chopper sorties,” said a source. Ajay Gupta’s son Surya Kant would tie the nuptial knot with Kritika, daughter of Suresh Singhal based in Delhi’s Rohini, and the ceremonies would be held between June 18 and June 22. In the second wedding, Atul Gupta’s son Shashank will marry Shivangni, daughter of Dubai-based Vishal Jalan, between June 20 and June 22. The high-profile guests will include Bollywood actors, business leaders, yoga guru Ramdev, chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat and a couple of state ministers. On Sunday, the Gupta family organized a grand feast for the local villagers who are invited to the main venue in Auli. “Over 150 guests would be staying in the hotel and in tents set up outside the hotel. All the arrangements have been completed,” said an executive associated with the firm managing the event. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Even if I am shot, you can\u2019t deny r.description: Nainital: Uttarakhand high court on Thursday, while hearing a public interest litigation, came down heavily on Uttarakhand Bar Council and Kotdwar district Bar Association for barring its members from representing the accused in court in connection with a murder case of a lawyer. The division bench of Chief Justice Ramesh Ranganathan and Justice Alok Kumar Verma remarked that everyone has a right to representation in court. “Even if someone shoots me, you cannot deny to represent the accused in court,” said the Chief Justice. He added that even a dreaded terrorist like Ajmal Amir Kasab of Mumbai attacks in November 2008, was provided a lawyer to represent him in court. Kartikey Hari Gupta, counsel for the petitioner in the matter told TOI, "The honorable court is very serious on this issue. According to Advocates Act, 1961 and Bar Council Rules, it's our bounden duty to represent our client before the court without any fear and under all circumstances." The bench issued urgent notices to Bar Association, Kotdwar and sought urgent reply from Bar Council of Uttarakhand and Bar Council of India in the matter. The PIL was filed by a practising advocate of Pauri district against a resolution of Kotdwar Bar Association which banned lawyers from taking up the case of an accused in an alleged murder of a lawyer, named Sushil Raghuvanshi, in 2017. First batch of Mansarovar pilgrims to re.description: Pithoragarh: The first batch of pilgrims, comprising 58 members, for this year’s Kailash Mansarovar Yatra will reach Pithoragarh district’s Dharchula on Friday. Before reaching Dharchula, which is a base camp for the yatra, the pilgrims were briefed by Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) officials at Didihat. In Didihat, ITBP officers briefed the pilgrims about security, weather on high altitudes, cleanliness and also on health issues. The pilgrims will also undergo health check-up before they leave from Dharchula. The Kailash Mansarovar Yatra through Lipulekh pass (at 17060 feet) started on June 12 from Delhi and on Wednesday, the group of pilgrims had reached Almora. Ashok Kumar, general manager, tourism of Kumaon Mandal Vikas Nigam (KMVN), said, “During the 21 days of the yatra, pilgrims will spend 14 days in India and the remaining seven days in China. According to this year’s schedule, 18 batches of pilgrims will trek across the Lipulekh pass in Uttarakhand while 10 other batches will go via the Nathula route in Sikkim. Thousands of devotees participate in the Yatra through a treacherous route that crosses territorial boundaries of India, Nepal and China. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MLA Champion accuses Delhi scribe of ext.description: Roorkee: After allegedly misbehaving with a Delhi-based TV journalist, BJP’s Khanpur MLA Kunwar Pranav Singh Champion on Friday filed an FIR against three persons, including the journalist and an official of Uttarakhand government, with Behror police station in Rajasthan’s Alwar district against alleged demand of extortion, defamation and trespass on Thursday. As the venue of “crime” was reported at Chanakyapuri in Delhi, the Rajasthan police registered his complaint under ‘zero FIR’ and then transferred the case to Chanakyapuri police station for further probe. According to Champion, he was staying along with his party workers in Uttarakhand Bhavan, the state guesthouse in New Delhi on Thursday when at 1 pm, Rajiv Tewari, a TV channel reporter and his cameraman visited him. But a few minutes later, they allegedly started demanding money from him. “They warned that if I did not pay money they would ruin my political career. When I raised strong objections, the duo approached the office of general manager of guesthouse Ranjan Mishra. They all started using filthy language against me. It was a conspiracy orchestrated by the trio against me to malign my public image for their vested interest,” alleged Champion. After the incident, the MLA left Delhi for Ajmer where he had to offer prayer at a Sufi shrine on Friday. On his way back, on Thursday, he filed his complaint over the Uttarakhand Bhavan incident with Behror police station in Alwar. The police registered his FIR under sections 504 (intentionally insult), 500 (defamation), 384 (demand of extortion), 511 (attempting to commit offences), 353 (assault to deter public servant from discharge of his duty), 451 (house trespass) and 34 (act by several persons with common intention) and transferred the matter to Chanakyapuri police station for further probe and action. However, another version of the incident says that the MLA first misbehaved with the reporter. According to sources, Tiwari's TV channel had recently aired a story on Champion that he was allegedly keeping an illegal ‘escort vehicle’ in his motorcade. This report allegedly annoyed him. TV reporter Tiwari said that one of Champion's aides called him that the MLA wanted to see him at the Chankyapuri guesthouse. When he reached there he started abusing him. "He said that media persons have become blackmailers so they could extract money from people like him. When I objected to his comments, he threatened me that he would shoot him after placing his firearm on the central table," Tiwari said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Will give report card of my 100-day work.description: Dehradun: Two weeks after taking charge as the Union Human Resource Development (HRD) minister, Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank, on Saturday, announced that he would present the report card of his 100- days work in the ministry to the people after three months. Speaking at a party event held to celebrate his elevation as the HRD minister at the BJP office, Nishank said, “After taking charge of the ministry, I held a meeting with officials and decided to tabulate all the works which I plan on completing in the next 100 days. I would present the report card of the works undertaken by my ministry to the people.” The HRD minister also invited suggestions from the media for the new education policy, saying, ““The National Education Policy draft is prepared and I request all of you to give suggestions for improvement in the policy.” Other state ministers including state education minister Arvind Pandey, MLA Harbans Kapoor, and state minister Dhan Singh Rawat, were also present at the event. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Uttarakhand seeks Rs 5,000 crore grant f.description: DEHRADUN: Chief minister TS Rawat met Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday and requested a one-time grant of Rs 5,000 crore to conduct Maha Kumbh 2021 on a grand scale. During the meeting held in New Delhi, Rawat said that the availability of funds would facilitate timely completion of projects in the state before the event which is likely to see a footfall of over 15 crore devotees. Sitharaman said that necessary help would be provided to the state at the earliest. Incidentally, Rs 700 crore was spent on Ardh Kumbh preparations in 2016, while the budget was around Rs 100 crore for the Maha Kumbh in 2010. The CM also met road transport minister Nitin Gadkari and requested him to approve national highway status for 17 roads, construction of a 47-km ring road in Haridwar and a four lane bridge on the Ganga at Jagjitpur, apart from providing clearance to 19 additional projects worth Rs 454 crore. He also requested the Union minister to complete the widening of Muzaffarnagar-Haridwar stretch by next year. Later, the chief minister met Jal Shakti minister GS Shekhawat and sought approval for projects worth Rs 802 crore under the Namami Gange scheme. Rawat also requested Shekhawat to release Rs 63 crore as payment for the irrigation department Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

18-member ITBP team starts from Nanda De.description: Dehradun: An 18-member team of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) set off from the Nanda Devi base camp on Saturday in an attempt to recover the bodies of eight climbers believed to be killed in an avalanche while trying to summit an unscaled peak near Nanda Devi East. Pithoragarh district magistrate Vijay Kumar Jogdande said that the team consists of “32 highly trained mountaineers of the ITBP.” “While 18 climbers will lead the recue efforts, 14 others will stay back to provide back-end support or serve as substitute,” he added. The DM said that the Indian Air Force has also been roped in to provide aerial support to the mission. “The ITBP team was air-dropped to the Nanda Devi base camp by IAF personnel. They also dropped support materials at the artificial landing zone built especially for the mission. IAF officials are also monitoring the situation,” he added. Jogdande said that the team is aiming to complete the mission, which is likely to take 20-22 days, before the onset of monsoon. “We want to finish the mission by the first week of July as rains will hinder the operation. It will become very difficult to recover the bodies if snowfall starts,” he added. Meanwhile, a team of the Indian Mountaineering Foundation (IMF), which had set out on a separate expedition to recover the bodies on Monday, has now reached the advanced base camp via an alternate route. IMF president HS Chauhan said, “Our team is chalking out the route further.” He added that the IMF team would also co-ordinate with the ITBP once they are in the vicinity of the spot where the trekkers’ bodies are believed to be buried under the snow. Eight members of a 12-member team, led by renowned British mountaineer Martin Moran, are believed to have died while on an expedition to summit the Nanda Devi East peak. Five bodies were spotted during an aerial survey, and the remaining members are also suspected to be dead. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi.
